pingball.simulation

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.simulation.GameObject
      • pingball.simulation.Ball

  • public class Ball
extends GameObject
    A ball that will be on the board. Represent by a moving circle, plus the gravity and mu1/mu2 that applies on it Rep Invariant: The gridlocation must be such that the ball does not exceed the board after accounting for its radius.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball(physics.Vect center,
    physics.Vect velocity,
    java.lang.String name,
    double gravity,
    double mu1,
    double mu2)
        Create a ball
        Parameters:
        center - a vector representing the location of the center of the ball
        velocity - a vector representing the direction and magnitude of the ball
        name - a string representing the name of the ball
        gravity - a double number representing the gravity that applies to the ball
        mu1 - a double number representing the first friction coefficient that applies to the ball
        mu2 - a double number representing the second friction coefficient that applies to the ball

      • collide

        public void collide(Ball ball,
           Collidable collidable)
        Collide this object with ball, changing the velocity of the ball and this object if this object. This method assume the two objects are at the point of impact. Note that this method mutates this object as well as the ball.
        Overrides:
        collide in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        ball - the ball that will collide with this ball object
        collidable - the Collidable object that actually collide with the ball

      • evolve

        public void evolve(double time)
        Evolve the ball for a particular amount of time. This method mutate the ball to some different location and change the ball velocity according to the friction and gravitation. This method assume that time is small enough that it is possible to simulate those forces with linear equation.
        Overrides:
        evolve in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        time - a double number representing the time for which the ball evolves

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(physics.Vect center)

        Parameters:
        center - a vector representing the location of the new center
